Evan took 15 cards and gave them to his dad.  Evan has 270 cards.  How many cards does his friend gave him?<n>Answer: 80<n><n>Input : There are 80 kids in school and 10 of them are not in school next week. They are off school on 7 days. Then they had Monday afternoon off. Thursday was a teacher only training day. Then they had the summer recess. Each day they had school they went to school for the same number of hours each week or they had the same school holiday schedule on school. How many different kinds of days are there in the year?<n>Answer: 92<n>1000040<n>Input:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The artist knew that this was the peak of his fandom, so he decided it was time for cashing in by doing what? Choices:  A: selling out B: happy C: fishing D: receiving money E: getting paid<n><n>### Response:		<n>* If a choice includes the word "by", then the action (or process) which you need to identify is after "by".<n>  * If the choice includes any other word (except "by"), then the action or process which you need to identify must happen **before the event / action** described in the question.<n>* If it's mentioned that the event / action is an ongoing / current / continuous or a "running" process, then you need to identify a "start" action / event or action immediately preceding the described process (which could be the only action that is actually in the description of the question).<n>* If the question is very generic and requires identifying what **one of** the options is, then "A/B/C/D/E" must be placed **immediately** before the verb. As in "Which of A/B/C/E/D **... is/are** the correct answer(s)". Except if it is a math question, as in "What is the answer?"<n>* A question which starts with "**Which of the following is the best description**" should be read as "Which of the following choices is the best description". If the first choice doesn't fit, move onto the second one and so on until you find one which fits.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. Choices A: you are not listening to me B: you are not writing down in your book C: you are not following what I am saying D: you are not understanding me<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Input  The teacher added 6 to a number and then subtracted 2. Three less than the new number was 25 less than the original number. What was the original number?<n><n>### B<n><n>### Input A farmer has 75 watermelons. One-sixth are ripe. How many ripe watermelons does the farmer have?<n><n>### Answer:<n>How many unripe is there if you know there are 75.<n><n>Unripe + ripe = 75<n><n>So,<n><n>75 / 6<n><n>(unripe / 6) + (ripe/6)<n><n>15(watermelon) + 7 (ripe)<n><n>### Input There is 93 children in the school and 41 of them are girls. What is the ratio of boys to girls in the school?<n><n>### Answers:4<n><n>### Input I am thinking of a number between five and fifteen. If I subtract four, it will leave me with an even number. How many jars does each candy-maker need to take to make the best cure for the orphans?<n><n>### Response1:The baker could make a cake with butter and almonds that would still taste good, while the toffee-maker could make a candy stick with just almonds. If the jelly-maker was the orphanage, she could make candy that would be eaten by children and also has jelly beans so that she would never be alone again.<n><n>### Response2:The best way to solve the problem is to use two licorice-makers. This will make them able to make a candy that has two different fillings. The first candy can have jelly beans because the licorice-maker can make it and the jelly-maker and the toffee-makers can make it. The second can have the shivery goo (the jelly-makers filling) and the butter from the baker.<n><n>### Input3:A group of 8 people are meeting to talk about the possibility of a school trip. If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Where would a restaurant put a candle? Choices:  A: dimly lit room B: kitchen C: wall D: table E: birthday cake<n><n>### Response:		It should have been the wall.<n><n>### Next Input:When is a birthday always on a different day of the week?<n><n>### Response:"When each day of the week is assigned a corresponding number and the number assigned to the birthday depends on the day in the month it occurs."<n><n>### NextInput:How many times do you get to count on number cards from 1 to 99 and not get a repeat?<n><n>###Response:"99, because you can divide the number by 9, the number 10, and 19, so you'll always get a new number."<n>

If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Where you have finished a conversation with a person what do you say? How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a computer other than a desk? Choices:  A: apartment B: table C: school D: office E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Computers are typically best suited for desks. Desks make it easier to work on the computer, whether that be by typing or watching content on the computer screen. When working on a computer, having it on a desk helps make it easier to access both the mouse and the keyboard. Without a desk, it ends up taking more time to use a computer. Computers are most commonly used in houses or offices.<n><n>### Input :If one of your relatives has a doctor’s appointment, can I be their carrier? Choices A: 1 : 1 B: 1 : 2 C: 2 : 1 D: Yes E: No<n><n>### Response<n>Yes you can. When going to the doctor, the person going to the appointment can be a carrier. A carrier is someone who simply transports a relative to another location.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>The relative is allowed to be a carrier if they can carry the person to the appointment on their own. Otherwise, they can take the car.<n><n>### Summary :<n>Ten stickers cost ten dollars. In each row, the products are defined by the following operation:<n><n>If the sum of two consecutive columns equals a certain number X, then the product of each whole number between 1 and X of the first column is equal to the sum of whole numbers between 1 and X from the second column. <n><n>### Table:<n>|	     a	    |	     b	    |	2	    |	3	    |	4	    |	7	    |	11	    |	13	    |	16	    |	19	    |	21	    |	24	    |	27	    |<n>|------------------|------------------|--------|--------|--------|------------|--------------|-------------|-----------------|--------|--------|-------|--------|-------|---------------|<n>| 	 0	    |	 1	    |	 3	    |	 6	|	 11	  |	 16	    | 	21	   	|	27	   	|	 16	  |	31	|	 56	|	 63	|	 87	    |<n><n>### Statments<n>For

How many percentages of the family's total income do the two items represent?<n><n>### Demostration:  <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pWO47q4K_pY" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe><n><n>### Response and Demonstration:  This question asks us the fraction in the box, it shows 0.12 and 0.88 for the second number. And we notice that these are the two percentages. So, we're looking at how many percentage of how many are equal to which fraction. So, 12 out of 200 I'm going to write them smaller like that, 2 for hundred. 12 out of a hundred is 2/100, and then 88 out of 20, 88 out of two is two eight, or 28/20, or 14/10.  So, we're told that it's less than 2% and that's 3/100, so it's gonna be 2/70 or 35/70, or 35% over 70%. <n>

Choices:  A: sign language B: complete sentence C: drink tea D: feel angry E: cross street<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If one of the people needs to do a task, they could do it by using sign language so that the other people in the group would understand what they really wants to say. <n><n>---<n><n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Write a program that completes the task below.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input 11<n>Input 2<n>Input-5<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Input:<n>Mary had 89 stickies.<n>She used 3 big stickies on the front page of<n>her journal and 7 big stickies each to 6<n>other pages of her journal.  How many<n>stickies does Mary have remaining? <n><n>Answer:<n>44<n><n>### Detailed <n><n>First, we should add one number to the total stickers. This is the amount of stickers at the beginning. When it's reached to the last page, the number of stickies will be zero. The second number should be the answer<n><n>- [x] If one of the people needs help, they can do it themselves or let people help them, but do not speak English because it will be difficult to understand. <n>- [x] One person needs help, the other person should be aware of the person's difficulties, they can do small kindness like drinking tea together.<n>- [x] Speaking one word one word at a time. If one person is having difficulties, they should slow down each word to help the other person understand.<n>- [x ] Other people in the group can help the person who is having difficulties. If the other person is uncooperative, that is because they are too busy or not feeling well. They may not have anything to say, they will wait for your help.<n><n>If it’s difficult to say, the person who does not want to say it will look for it elsewhere, such as searching the Internet, or writing it down.<n>- [x  ] If it is difficult, they will do it themselves, but do not help the person who is not cooperative. If there are enough people, they can do simple help. That way, we don't just need a few people to help each other.<n>Input:<n><n>Zach is saving his money to purchase a brand new bike.<n>His weekly allowance is 5$.<n>His parent will pay

How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The investigator considered the gun evidence, where did he send it? Choices:  A: drawer B: back to its owner C: police station D: crime scene E: holster<n><n>### Response:		Investigators send all guns found at a crime scene to the station at the headquarters of their police department. Investigators will only take the gun from the criminal if there is enough evidence to charge them. When this happens, the investigators will inform their department, then the criminal will be taken into custody and the department will proceed with the case.

If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Sally took her medicine and experienced strong side effects.  What did doctors say about the side effects? Choices:  A: great B: distinguished C: remarkable D: excellent E: peculiar<n><n>### Response:		<n>Explanation: <n>```<n>Choice A has a single word instead of more sentences which makes it a better choice because it shows an example.<n>Choice B has grammatical errors(distinguished from distinguished) which means choice B should be eliminated.<n>Choice C has grammatical errors in its sentence formation <n>Choice D does not clearly states the side effect and uses ambiguous words which make D unlikely.<n>Choice E has ambiguous words which makes it too vague to select.<n>Explanation: The choice B is grammatically incorrect.<n>You use "from" when you want to indicate starting from, as in “I bought 100 cents worth of fruit, but from those 100 ccent only 38 cents remain”<n>You use "than" when you want to compare one thing to another. In Choice B it did not compare "distinguished" to "distinguished", but distinguished to extraordinary.<n><n>Choice B should not be eliminated because Choice B can stand alone, it has strong points or it is an exception to every rule. Choice B can be revised to make it better.<n>```<n><n><n><n>### Final Note<n>We welcome your feedback. Let's continue to work hard and keep learning!<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:You can buy a pen here. What is the combined value of a million dollar bill?<n>### Instruction#2: The number of minutes in a thousand dollar bill equals the number of seconds in a hundred dollar plus the number of hours in a million dollars plus 365. What is the combined number of hours in a billion dollars?<n>### Response: 155<n><n>### Instruption:The number of seconds in a week is the number of hours in 52 days plus the number of times a clock in a hundred dollar bills stops every fifteen minutes. How many seconds are in a week?<n>### Response:# of seconds: 355,002<n><n># Taken from the book "Teach Yourself Programming In Ten Minutes A Day"<n><n>## Task:<n>In the following exercises, use a flowchart that consists of three boxes to draw the following graph.<n><n>The first box should be labeled 20,000, the second should be labeled 14,000, and the third should be labeled 800,00. Choices:  A: library B: parties C: kindergarten class D: bar E: school<n><n>### Response:		<n>If a student is about to graduate, we say that they are about to leave school. If we are talking about kindergarten students, students who have just completed kindergarten would no longer be kindergarten students. If we are talking kindergarten students graduating from kindergarten, they would be attending the next grade, and we would say they were 'in' their next grade. Other than that, the choices don't seem right to me.<n><n>### Input:(The question has four choices)<n>I used all four and I got it wrong every time. My second guess was different and I got it wrong again.<n><n>### Difficulty Level:<n>Easy<n>

Choices:  A: south pacific B: sea world C: pacific ocean D: indian ocean E: gulf of mexico<n><n>### Response:		<n>(C)<n><n>### Input :<n>Who do you trust to make important financial decisions? Choices:  a: your boss b: your mom or dad<n><n>### Response :<n>(A)<n><n>### <n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Why would someone confess to committing murder? Choices:  A: guilty conscience B: fear C: go free D: problems E: find god<n><n>### Response:		<n>- (1) guilty conscience<n><n>### Input and responses:<n>A: a, c, b, d, c, e, d<n><n>### Input(a):<n>A woman is buying vegetables at a store. In the store, there are 1.5 kg of 1 vegetable type and 0.5 kg of 2 vegetable types. The price of each vegetable type is $2.50. How much will it cost if she is buying 3.5kg of those vegetables?<n><n>### Solution:<n>- (1st) a + (2nd, 3rd, 4th) 2<n>- (1st, 3rd,...)<n>- b (1st, 2nd, 3)<n>- a + (2nd...9th)b<n><n>Input: The number of times each vegetable is bought by a customer in a restaurant.<n><n>Choice:<n>a: 23,000,000<n>b: 90,000,200<n>c: 110,500,005<n>d: 95,000,100<n>e: 89,000,501<n>input : 90<n>answer : d <n>  <n>  
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The crowd wasn't that big.  It can better be described as what? Choices:  A: field B: alone C: small group D: solitude E: solitary<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>In the sentence "the crowd wasn't that...", "not that..." indicates that the crowd was...something else. The choices are: A: Field; B: alone; C: small group; D: solitude; E: solitary. The answer is in the sentence itself <n><n>### Input:"Money doesn't buy happiness..."  Which of the following statements completes the sentence? Choices: <n>A: Quote B: Question C: Statement D: Complaint <n><n>### Response:"...But I would sure like to try"<n><n>In the given sentence, the blank needs a phrase that expresses a thought that's similar to the last part (or the entire sentence) of the phrase used in the sentence's other half. The answer is in bold.<n><n>### Input"Even before the baby's due date, it was clear that..." Choices: A: The baby was a good father. B: He was a nice man.  C: He loved baby stuff.  D: He was very thoughtful. E: He was prepared for baby.<n><n>### Response"...He was prepared for baby."<n><n>In this question the blank needs a phrase describing how the man was prepared for the baby to be born. The answer is in italic.<n><n>### A teacher asks the students a question about a story they read in class.  Choices: <n>1.What does the following statement suggest?<n>A:The teacher knows nothing.  B:The teacher is not telling the truth.  C:The teacher knows the answer. <n><n>### A: The teacher is not telling thetruth<n><n>In the statement the blank needs a statement describing how the student knows the answer to the question. The answer is in a different color.<n><n>### The book will arrive by air mail.  It will probably arrive next week.  Which of the following is true of the shipping of the book to the customer? Choices: 1.It will arrive on Friday. B: It will be shipped by ground service.  C: It will arrive sooner than expected.  D: It will arrive the next week.<n><n>### D: It will arrive...<n><n>In the sentence, the part highlighted by **this red** indicates what the customer knows, and can be the sentence of the answer that you provide

Choices:  A: hang in closet B: sniff C: get dirty D: become soiled E: air out<n><n>### Response:		If clothes have developed a smelly smell (from cooking or some other reason) they should be either put in the washing machine or hand washed and let them hang to dry. The smelly smell will come out from using warm water. And if after putting the clothes in the washing machine still they don't smell nice, you can put them into the dryer for 5 minutes.<n><n>### Challenge:Write a request that is appropriate for the above instruction and response.<n><n>### Hint: A good idea to show a good writing skill is to start the instructions with "You should..", so students will know your intention.<n>

Then begin a second sentence that directly answers the question, restates the statement, or questions the assertion. Write your two sentences on one line. Use as much detail as possible in each of your responses.<n><n>### Example:<n>Below is a task with a question followed by two responses. Write a response that is based on the question, or an alternate question, statement, or answer.<n><n>### Task:<n>Gasoline is one of the expensive items in the average driver's travel budget. Insurance and car payments can be much higher than gasoline.<n><n>### In the response, the author makes an assertion and asks a question. Here we have a sample response.<n><n>### Assertion:<n>*If driving costs that much more, why is the speed limit the maximum?*<n><n>The  speed limit is the greatest speed that is considered to be safe for the environment and the driving.<n>

How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Where could you put some olives to prevent them from getting nearby food wet? Choices:  A: eaten B: glassess C: jar D: pizza E: refrigerator<n><n>### Response:		<n>E is the best answer.<n><n>Olives are often served on their own. When you have them, you don't mix other food together with the olives because the other food get in contact with olives.<n><n>A: Olive and other foods are meant to be mixed. If you mix and eat all foods together, the food don't get wet.<n><n>B: Glasses are meant to touch other foods to be mixed together so the olives will get wet.<n><n>C: In a jar, the olives won't touch the foods and don't get wet because it is closed.<n><n>D: Pizza will get the olives wet.<n><n>### Response 2<n><n>The 7 students are eating lunch.  They want to eat 8 sandwiches and 6 chips but they only have enough money to buy a total of 6 sandwiches and 9 chips.  How could they split 12 meals between them?<n><n>* Option 1:<n><n>   1. They can break an eighth of a sandwich into 3 pieces and eat two pieces of the broken sandwich and 2 chips.<n><n>   2. They can eat one sandwich and two chips.<n><n>* Option 2:<n><n>   1 They can eat one sandwhich and one chip.<n><n>   2 They can eat one-sixth of a sandwich and 3 chips.<n><n>### Detailed step by step solution:<n><n><n>| Choice 1 | Choice 2 |<n>| - | - |<n>| A. 1, 2 | B. 1 |<n>| A.2, 3 | C. 1,2 |<n>| C. 3 | D. 2 |<n>| D. 3, 4 | E. 1 |<n><n>### Input and Solution<n><n>A group of people went to see a movie. The ticket of adults cost $5 and children cost $3. There were 9 people went to see that movie. There are 4 people in the group, including the adults. What was the total amount of the ticket?<n><n>### Solution<n><n>The total amount of tickets should be $9.<n>The amount of adult is 4 * $5 + 4 * $3 = $42
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:James wanted to stop competing.  What might he have been feeling? Choices:  A: pressure B: death C: trying harder D: quitting E: winning or losing<n><n>### Response:		James quit<n><n><n># Including Comments

Choices:  A: satisfaction B: good feelings C: complications D: feel good about yourself E: stress<n><n>### Response:		A<n>*A is correct answer in the instruction. The correct answer will be in the response below and there will be some differences with the instruction <n>*if the instruction doesn't mention a question mark after "good feelings" then there is not a question mark at the end of the sentence<n><n>### Input<n>Danny hated helping them.<n>It always brought him the correct answers in the question and made him feel good about himself.<n><n>### Response<n>It always brought [him] good [feelings]. (A is correct answer)<n>

If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What is something you do  in a bank? Choices: A, B, C D E.<n><n>```python<n>a =int(input("What size of pants do Mary like? "))<n>if (a == 'a'):<n>  print('answer = 26')<n>if (a =='b'):<n>  print('Answer = 28')<n>if (a=='c') :<n>  print('Answer= 30')<n>if (a)=='d':<n> answer = 'Answer= 32'<n>print(' Answer= 34')<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:<n>- There are the following kinds of numbers: Prime numbers, Composite numbers, and Square numbers. Otherwise, they're all just food court.<n>### Input: How many more seconds does a 30-second movie show?<n>Answer: 50%<n><n>##### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>##### Demonstration<n>Input: An unloaded fishing boat capsized. If its weight of cargo was 85,000kg, what is the total weight of the boat and cargo after the disaster, including the cargo?<n>Answer: 75,000 kg<n><n>Input: How does the cost of goods sold affect a company's Income statement?<n>Answer: Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) increases profits by reducing the company's current assets. If the cost of goods sold for a company was $40,000 and sales totaled $100,000, then the company's profit is $60,000. For every $10 increase in goods sold, the profit increases by $4; for every $6 decrease in goods sold, the net income decreases by $1. If the same company sold $98,000 worth of products in one year, what was the company's net income?<n>Answer: 87,200<n><n>Input: A man went into a shop to buy a pair of trousers.  The trousers cost $100 and there was an 8% tax.  He paid $100 for the trousers and $8 for the tax.  In what way did the tax amount ($8) apply to the total price of the trousers ($100)?<n>Answer: The tax amount ($8) was the amount of interest to the total price of trousers ($118).<n><n>Input: Jack's grandfather is 30 years older than Jack. How many years ago was their birthdays separated by 8 years?<n>Answer: There was an eight-year gap.<n><n>Input: What number is equal to 61, but if you add just two digits to that number you get 2018?<n>Answer: Two thousand and eighteen or 2018<n><n>Input: A baseball player has an unusual strategy for avoiding a hard

If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. The second parameter value must always come <n>after the first one.<n><n><n>### Output<n>The function returns the sum of the multiplied <n>values.<n><n>### The goal<n>You must make sure that any user who calls the function gets his result. You have already made functions that will return a string <n>of words like this one: <n><n>### Example:<n><n>### Expected result<n><n>### Examples for test purposes:<n><n>### Challenge<n>Make the code as simple and readable as possible.<n><n><n>## Solution<n><n>````js<n>function addNumbers(number1, number2) {<n>   return number1 * number2;<n>}<n>````<n>```<n>a=1<n>b=2<n>c=a+b<n>document.write(c)<n>```<n>

If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The evacuation became mandatory, so what came on the TV? His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. Assign and initial variable value of M to 8. Below the table you see four different operations to perform on the values in the table. Performing an operation on a value requires you to multiply or divide the value by two, to the power of the operation. The operation is performed in the manner that follows:<n><n>### For a value you should multiply the value by 2 to the power of the number of times you are to perform the operation.<n><n>### For example, to divide a value by 2 to 6, you multiply the value by 16 to 6, which is 16.<n><n>### To the power 1, so a = a; to the power 2, so a*2, to the power 3, so<n>a*2 = a*12; to the power 4, so a*2*2; to the power, so a*<n>2**4 = a*32.<n><n>### Then divide the value and multiply this by an inverse of 14, which is what we did above.<n><n>

Choices: 15 days ago 16 days ago 17 days ago 18 days ago 19 days ago 20 days ago 21 days ago 22 days ago 23 days ago 24 days ago 25 days ago 26 days ago 27 days ago 28 days ago 29 days ago 30 days ago 31 days ago<n><n>Answer: 10 days ago<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Exlanation:<n>If the payday is 21, 22, or 23 days after my last payday then it will be 15 days ago.  If it is 16 days ago then the next pay day is the 15th and I have been paid exactly 2 months ago. There is only one other answer that could be considered true but I think of it as a 0 day pay day and then my next payday is 15 days after.<n><n>```python<n>from math import floor<n><n>class Solution:<n>    def calculateTomorrowSalary(self, daysAfterPayDay: int) -> int:<n>        daysAfterPayDay = floor(daysAfterPayDay)<n><n>        # payday is 25 and

Choices:  A: good health B: finger C: meat D: body E: own family<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A)<n>When chopping onion, good health is the answer to reduce the sting while cooking.<n><n>#### B)<n>When chopping off the skin, finger is the most appropriate answer.<n><n>#### C)<n>Chopping onion in the meat is not an answer to avoid the sting in the meat.<n><n>#### D)<n>Chopping onions on the body will result in chopping the onions body tissues.<n><n>#### E)<n>Family refers to a group of people who live together. Cooking onions in families refers to cooking for the family members in their own households, not others.

How many kilos is that?<n>```<n><n>Correct Response:<n>```<n>2.84 kilos<n>```<n><n>## Input: Mary had 86 stickers. She used 2 large stickers on the top page of her journal, and 7 stickers to each of six other pages of her journal, How many stickers does she have left?<n>```<n>45 stickers<n>```<n><n>## Demonstartion<n>```<n>The number 917, can you divide it by 1/3?<n>```<n><n>`Answer: 917 / 3 = 305.666`<n><n>## Instruccion<n>```<n>The book jacket weighs 32 ounces. The book itself weighs 13 pounds. How much does it weigh?<n>```<n><n>Answer:<n>```<n>14 pounds<n>```<n><n>## Question:<n>```<n>1) There were 20 children in a party. 1/3 of them were boys.  If 5/9  of the children were girls, how many children were boys?<n>```<n><n>A) 9<n><n>C)4<n><n>B)0<n><n>D)8<n><n>E)7<n><n>```<n>** Answer: D 5/9 of 1/3 of 20 => 5/9 times 20/3

The next number is a multiple of -1. The next two numbers are multiples of 7. Choose the multiple of 2 that is between them.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>The first number is 4 because the number after a multiple of 9 is also a multiple of 9.<n><n>The second number is also a multiple of -1 because we subtract 5 from it to give the result a multiple of 1.<n><n>The next two numbers are multiplis of 7 because you have 7 +/-1 which is 8.<n><n>Since the next multiple of 2 is 4, it is also between -2 and 0.<n><n>### Input :- 104, 20, 2, -2, 18, 32, 28, 16, 99, 85, 24, 50, 80, 36, 56, 125, 117, 221, 174, 365, -96, -25, 105, 95, -70, 51, 990 and -25<n><n>### Short answer:-  Which of these numbers is bigger?<n><n>### Input<n>- 275, 305, 310, 315<n><n>### Response 275<n><n>### Input  Which of these is smaller than the others? Choice A is the smallest and choice E is the greatest.<n><n>##

Task #2:<n><n>The number of hours of TV each day varies, but the median number of viewers among a group of children aged 5 and 7 is 1.  If two-thirds of the children watch less than 2 hours of TV each day, what is the greatest amount of time that one child in this sample could watch?<n><n>### Instruct:1.What would be the correct response to this question?<n><n>### Dem:1.<n>Input: The number of hours of TV of each day varies,  But the median number of viewing of children among a group of children that is 5 and 7 years is 1. 2/3 of the children watch less that 2 hours TV each day, but what is the greatest amount that one child may watch?<n>Answer: 5<n><n>### Demstration: 2.<n>Input: The median number of viewers that children watch is 45 hours each day. 70% of the children watch less tahn 1 hour. Choices:  A: nailed B: carved C: polished D: eat cake E: petrify<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### What did you do?<n>My original response was to just guess because I'm unfamiliar with the word petrify and I'm not sure that it's even used correctly in the question. So I googled "what is done to wood to attached something to it to make it permanant" after taking out unfamiliar words like petrify and after removing things not necessary in the sentence like the word "making it permanent" and the word "permanent". I think I did this because I was under the impression that there was a lot of choice B options but this did not produce results. Then I tried guessing but my guess was incorrect. So I gave up and looked at the answer for more references on the process of "attaching something to wood." Then I looked at some pictures. I found a picture of a chair which appears to have been carved into. As it is carved the wood then becomes molded to have a specific shape that creates the chair. And since it is molded they cannot change the shape of it and then it has stayed that way for a while if not permanently. So I think A: nailed because nailing things to wood is what makes things permanant.<n><n>### How did it work?<n>Google is a good way to figure out things about which you are uncertain. Also, pictures, even bad pictures may be useful in understanding how the process of what we ask the program to do is done. Also, pictures of what people do on a particular computer system may shed light on how to do things on a computer system or understand what a program that is asking you to do something will mean. For example here I could not understand what carving a log would create. So I looked at what types of wood, and other hardwood materials are used to design chairs. After viewing such a picture I quickly realized that nailing stuff is not the way to hold together a chair. Instead they put something against the chair that is softer to break as the chair needs to break for the chair to hold weight. I think people use wood because of how strong it is and how much weight it can hold.<n><n>### Things you learned while doing this?<n>When asking a program to do something. If you are unsure of the meaning of a word, look it up. If you do not understand the question, look up images of things similar to what the question asks about doing

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The game was on sale.  I got it then because it was usually what? Two times 10 plus two times 2 is _____<n>### Response : Four times 10
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:After his mother saw his report card he knew he was going to be doing housework, what could have prevented this? Choices:  A: sneezing B: fatigue C: house clean D: feeling satisfied E: getting good grades<n><n>### Response:		E 6

Choices:  A: brown hair B: names C: two eyes D: will E: brains<n><n>### Response:		People in the same family often have two eyes<n><n>### Input:"Is it a girl or a boy?" What number will most likely match the question? Choices: A: 7 B: 9 C: 2 D: 9<n><n>### Response:"Is it a girl?" the number will most likely be 7<n><n>### Input"I bet it is a boy, because the odds are the boy would not have as many teeth when he is born." What number best describes the odds? Choices: A 1 B: 2 C: 3 D: 3<n><n>### Response"The odds are the boy will have significantly fewer teeth when he is born than the girl." the number 1 is correct<n><n>### InputWhich is the biggest number in the whole group?<n><n>### Response2<n><n>### InputIn a family of four, there are 2 daughters and 2 sons.  In addition, there are 2 of each. How many grandchildren do they have between them?<n><n>### SolutionIn a family of four. There are 2 daughters and two sons. In addition there are 2 of their Grandchildren between them.  The answer is 12 Grandchildren.<n><n>### InputThe sum of an age of 3 children is 10 years old. If one of those children is 1 year older than the sum of other children. How old is the youngest child?<n><n>### SoltuionThe sum of an age. Is going to be 9. The difference between youngest child and the elder children will be 9 plus 1 is 10. That means that the youngest child will be 9.<n><n>### Task:Use the table below to answer the following questions.<n><n>|Name|Age|Number of siblings|Number of siblings under age 14|<n>|:----------|:---------:|:-------------:|:---------: |<n>|Amber|12|2|1|<n>|Zoe|14|3|1|<n>|Mike|6|4|2|<n><n>```<n>Answer:<n>1). Amber is 12 years old.<n><n>If we look at siblings number<n>- siblings under age of 2 is 2<n>- siblings under the age of 14is 1

Choices:  A: notoriety B: emotional distress C: riot D: bad dreams E: annoyance<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:What does the letter code ABC stand for?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: If you reverse the letters B D C, you get A C E.  If you reverse the letters A C E, you get D B C.  If you reverse letters ABC, you get C B D.  This shows that the letters spell the word backward.<n><n>### What are the values of the three letters if they are:  A: B, C B: D, E C: B, E<n><n>### Response D<n><n>### Instuctions:This is the answer to the question:  A: a pen B: a pencil C: a sword D: a wrench<n><n>### Demos:<n>Input: The word weapon is spelled with the letter U, I, Q, F, S, N, T, and E.<n><n>### A: pen  B: pencil C: sword D: wrench<n><n>## Input: The number of times a word appears in a sentence.<n><n>## A: count  B: find  C: find the answer  D: count<n><n>The instruction is missing the following instructions which will guide you on what to do next.<n><n>## Demostration: If you count the number of times a word is used in a sentence, you can learn about the sentence's structure and meaning.<n><n>## A count <n><n>## Demosturation: If you find the words, you can understand the sentence better. The use of this word in the sentence could also refer to the meaning of the sentence or the structure of the sentence.<n><n>## Find the answer<n><n>## Demostrustion: If you find the answer to a question, you can find out the purpose of the question.<n><n>## Find<n><n>## Demostraction: If you count the words, you can learn their meanings.<n><n>## Count<n><n>## Demostruction: If you count the word and find the word, you can learn about its structure.<n><n>## Count <n><n>## Demotion: If you count the numbers of words in a sentence, you understand the structure of the sentence better.<n><n>## A<n>

How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Where would you sit in a chair to watch four-legged animals complete? Choices:  A: bookstore B: house C: race track D: friend's house E: building<n><n>### Response:		A<n>	<n>	Answer: A<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple questions.<n><n>Q1: If I have $250, and then I get a coupon for $20 of food and spend $97.50 on food, how much do I have left?<n><n>A1: I only have $36.50 after I spend $97.80<n><n>(Hint: Make a table that summarizes your calculations for each multiple choice question)<n><n>q2: If I have $1,500, and then I apply for a raise and I get $800, then I am out $600, and how much do I have leftover?<n><n>A2: I only have $800 left after I spend all my money<n><n>(Hint: You can use a table to show your calculations)<n><n>q3: I pay $98 to watch a movie, and then the movie costs half as much if I rent it, and I have to pay $7.50 to rent my bicycle. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What would children do if they are bored? Choices:  A: walk B: change shoes C: play tag D: smell smoke E: reach over<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Why: A is walk. B is change shoes. C is play tag. D is smell smoke. E is reach over.<n><n>### Input :What is the color of this t-shirt?<n><n>### Response :Blue<n><n>### Why : Blue shirt<n><n>### Input   : Find a fraction with a numerator 1, denominator 5, and a quotient of 43<n><n>### Response   : 0<n><n>### Why  : The only fraction that matches the criteria is<n><n>### Input  : A new pizza store opened near the elementary school. It costs $5.85 for a large pizza at the store. On average, the total cost for delivery of a large pizza is $5.00. The school store bought two large pizzas for $10.00. How much money did the pizza cost at the school store?<n><n>### response  : 12.50<n><n>###Why  : The new store opened and it cost them $5.85 and on average it cost $5.00 to deliver the pizza. When they bought two large ones they bought 15, 60, 80 to make it $12.50. The math involved is 15(60)0 which is 12.5.<n><n>###Input  : A father, mother, and baby bird, along with three other birds, are on a tree branch and eating. If the total of the weight of birds is 1 pound, how heavy is each bird?<n><n>###Response  : 282<n><n>###Why : Because there is 12 birds on the branch. Each one being 25 and the total of the 13 birds is 330 lbs. Multiply that by 12  to get 400 so divide by 400= 100, divided by 4 therefor 25 each=282.<n>

Choices:  A: train station B: house C: cupboard D: cricket stadium E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Choice (A) - Only a select few people go to the train station while the others take the bus or subway. The only people currently breathing in the train station right now would be the security and cleaning crew. The passengers already went home. <n><n>Choice (B)&(C)&(D) - Only a few people live in that house and they only use that cupboard if they bake something or put food and drinks in there. The cupboard is not occupied right now. <n><n>Choice(E) - I do believe that there are traces of human breath in the atmosphere but that is not what we specifically asking here.  All we want to know is which place is the most crowded.<n><n>### Input:"Two-fourths of twelve means four".<n><n>### Response:"Two-fourth of 12 is four."<n><n>### Input "The number of crows in a flock is two more than the number of sparrows in a flock. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The king was to meet an ambassador, where would the meet? Choices:  A: court B: dinning room C: throne room D: monarchy E: castle<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input<n>The queen was to meet an ambassdor, where would the meetings location be?<n><n>### Solution:<n>The court.<n><n>### Input 1<n>Which of these choices are the correct sequence of operation?<n><n>### Response 1<n><n>### Input : How many different values can be chosen for the missing digit.<n><n>### Solution :<n>4<n><n>### Inputs :<n>1. 44<n>2. 6<n><n>Output<n><n>### Answer<n><n>

Choices: B: 14 hours C: 23 days D: 2 hours E: 1 day<n>### Response: C, his time to finish will be 23 days.<n><n>### Response : D, the answer can be A, B or D.<n><n>### Question:Write a script.<n>```text<n>1 - Ask user: how much money?<n>2 - Write (Write the money) on the screen<n>3 - Ask user how many chillers he/she needs<n>4 - While 3 <= input && input!= 0 <n>  Write the money and (how many do you need)? on the screen<n>5 - Until user answers to "quit"<n>```<n>

He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Riding bike through rough terrain can be dangerous, one could find themselves what? Choices:  A: pleasure B: accident C: get somewhere D: hurt E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>#### What I understood:<n><n>- One could find themselves: getting somewhere, hurt, falling down, getting hurt, falling down<n><n>- They can be dangerous: if the riders ride a dangerous terrain, it is possible for them to find themselves getting hurt, fall down or get somewhere<n><n>- Which means it is up to the rider how they react to the bicycle trip, if it turns into a dangerous or not.. It is a free will process.<n><n>#### What I applied:<n><n>- I understood how the question is asking the reader to use logic<n><n>#### What I have to remember:<n><n>This could be applied to any subject I have to test, since it is about logic and how to use it. In this sentence, they use a bike trip as reference for the question, but in a math question, they might use something related to that number system as reference.. Maybe..<n><n>#### How this could be used in the future:<n>	1. I could apply this one day when doing a test, because sometimes a question sounds complicated, but using logic, it becomes very simple. It helps me to see how I can see how the question is asking that I make the answer simple and correct.<n>

If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What are ai machines known for doing? Choices:  A: fly B: milk cows C: eat D: answering questions E: fail to work<n><n>### Response:		Choices: A: B: C: D: E: <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:People are purposefully harming others, what trait are they exhibiting? Choices:  A: deceptive B: altruistic C: stupid D: cruel E: agressive<n><n>### Response:		  It doesn't seem to be very deceptive because the people is purposefully harming others. What he is exhibiting is cruel.

How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The person is laying on the beach, why would he do that? Choices:  A: sun himself B: thank god C: race against time D: express love E: to think about things.<n><n>### Response:		<n>Let A-F represent the choices.<n><n>The statement implies that the person does not believe in God.<n><n>We also can infer that the person believes that God is the only way to think about things. <n><n>Thus, the person is not thinking about things by doing any of those choices and, since he is laying on the sand, he must believe in God.<n>

Choices:  A: being understood B: beer C: playing around D: hug E: visiting friends<n><n>### Response:		<n>I think the correct answer is being understood. Because most of the times, when people have fun with their friends or try to fit in, they are seeking to get it from their friends and to get it from anyone around them. This has to do with the fact that people generally have a hard time expressing themselves or getting understood when they feel they are not good at something.<n>

The pencil thet left after taking 11.7 p are 1030.<n>   </div><n></details>

You end up at your original location. What are the coordinates for your location?<n>Answer: (-10,-3)<n><n>### Answer:<n>Start coordinates = (0,0)<n>Turn right: 20 feet<n>Walk: 0 feet(stop)<n>Turn left: 28 feet<n>Walk: (28-4)/2 = 14 feet<n>Turn right: 8 feet<n>Walk distance = (0-14-8) = -10<n><n>### Instructor:If a man makes $3 per hour and a woman makes $3 per hour. Zach's babisit job is $10 and that's guaranteed.<n><n>### Total: <n>6+10=16<n><n>### Input 1:<n>Mark has 23 koangaroues, 3 times as many goats, and 30 more goats than koangaroues.<n><n>### Goats have more legs than koangarouese, 4 legs vs 2 legs.<n><n>### Koangaroues have 2 legs times 23 = 46<n><n>### Goat legs have 4 times 30 = 120 extra goats than koangoraues<n><n>### Total = 166 legs<n><n>### Insttuctions: <n>Answer 2 legs for each koangaroo because koangarouese have 2 legs, so 23 koangaroes has 46<n>
