He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:A person notices popcorn, cotton candy on the grass, where is he likely? Choices:  A: soccer game B: fairgrounds C: movie theatre D: countryside E: state park<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices could be soccer games because it contains the children, and also children like the soccer matches, and therefore there would be many popcorns, cotton candy because the children may want this food as a snack, and there is also no place for cotton candy in the other choices.<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Why shouldn't you walk barefooted after the rain? Choices:  A: shoes B: wet ground C: wet clothes D: start to fall E: water garden<n><n>### Response:		Choices: A, B, C, D, E<n><n>### Input:(1 point) John is the new kid on the block.  How old is John?<n><n>### Response:(0.05 point) 12. 14. 15. 13<n><n>### Input.John wants 83 toes of towel.  His mom says she has only 55 toes of towel to give him.  If each towel has 28 toes, how many towels does John want to take from the pile?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: 79<n><n>### Response.0.21<n><n>### Input.(1 point)How many squares are in the bottom left corner of the chess board?<n><n>### Input ((0.05 point)) The square you are sitting in is 4 feet to the left and 7 feet from front to back.  How much is the width of the room?<n><n>### Demo:<n>Input: 4<n><n>### Demstration:<n>Input:(1 point) 4<n><n>## Solution<n><n>\begin{code}<n>Answer 1:<n>function main() {<n><n>    var input;<n>    var response= "not input\n";<n><n>    input= prompt("Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question.");<n>    if(input== input1) response+="good"<n>    else response+="not good\n";<n><n>Answer 2:<n>function main()<n>{<n>    var input; // Variable to store and hold the users input<n>    var response= '';<n>    var count = 0;<n>    var sum = 0;<n><n>    if ( typeof arguments[2] == 'function') // Test if function was passed<n>    {<n>        sum = arguments[2].call(null); // call function with undefined, pass in arguments[2]<n>    }<n>    else<n>    {<n>        for (var i = 0; i < arguments.length; ++i) // Iterate through arguments<n>        {<n>            sum += arguments[i]; // Add argument as value to the sum<n>        }<n>        if (typeof sum == 'number') // Check, if the value is a numerical type<n>        {<n>            if (sum <= expectedValue) // If value
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The doctor recommended washing hands, what was being promoted? Choices:  A: cold hands B: wet floor C: health D: become wet E: dry skin<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>```python<n># Instructions<n># Input : The doctor recommended washing hands<n># What was being promoted? <n># Promote clean hands, and be hygiene<n># The doctor is asking to everyone to wash hands for the cleanliness.<n># Choices:  A,B,C,D<n><n># Output: A<n>```<n><n>---<n><n>### Input:(There was a contest going on, which was offering to provide 100 gift cards each of $50), What was being offered? <n><n>### Response Choices: A: ten gift cards. B: fifty gift cards. C: $500. D: $10,000. E: $500,000<n><n>---<n><n>```python<n>import codecs<n>from collections import Counter<n><n>count = codecs.open('input','r','utf-8').read().split('\n')<n>count = list(map(lambda x:x.strip(),count))<n><n>countWashingHands = Counter(count)['A']<n>print(f"Count Washing Hands is [{countWashingHand].50}'s")<n>countWashingHands = Counter(count)[7]<n>print(f'Count Washing Hanks is {countWashingHand}.5''s')<n><n>print('The correct answer is A')<n>```<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Billy's mother tripped over a stuffed animal.  She yelled at him not to leave his things where? Choices:  A: toy store B: hall C: bathroom D: amusement park E: fairgrounds<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions: Write a response that appropriates completes the request.

How many girls are attending the party?<n><n>### Demystification:<n>The answer is 20<n><n><div class="answer" ><h2>Input: </h2><div class="answer-text">Dan said that getting in  line was the best  choice because it would lead  to  what?  <ul><li>A:  being  ordered  </li><li>B:  less  confusion  </li><li C:  boredom  </li><li D:  standing in line  </li></ul></div><n></div><n>### Input:What is an angle? Choices:  A: table B: restaurant C: cupboard D: kitchen E: sink<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A: B: C: D: E:<n><n>**A:** Silverware should be put in the cupboard.<n>**B:** Silverware is put in the sink.<n>**C:** Silverware is only put in the dishwasher.<n>**D:** Silverware is not put in the cupboard because silverware is put in the cabinets.<n>**E:** Silverware is never put in the sink or cabinet.It is put on the table or the counter until it is used.<n><n>### Input :John has been saving up to buy a bike. You are required to type out your exact steps, including the following:<n><n>* Type your text into WritePad.<n>* Turn on speech function in the device you are using or the Google Chrome Speech to Text function.<n>* Go to dictate.<n>* Click on the word you are talking about.<n>* Read the first letter or word of the sentence you are talking about. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. What is an object that is an abstract type?<n><n>2. What is the definition of a function?<n>	- The return type of a function must match all of the parameters.<n>	<n>3. What is a keyword constructor?<n>	- constructor of built-in functions<n>	- These are all the built-in functions.<n>		- if<n>		- while<n>		- for...<n>		- switch<n>		- break<n>		- continue<n>		<n>4. What the difference between a reference and the value of a variable?<n>	- A value is what is held inside a variable. When two variables hold the same value, they have a reference.<n><n>5. What is the purpose of a default constructor?<n><n>6. What is a struct?<n>	- is a user-defined data-type that contains data that can be accessed from a class by its fields. <n>	- An array is a type of a struct. <n>	- When a struct is initialized, all values inside the struct are defaulted until a new value is given in the initialization.<n>	- Can have private, protected, and public members. <n>	- Can contain variables inside of other variables using pointers.<n>	- Can be given more then one constructor<n>

How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What kind of radio does someone use to reach base? Choices:  A: vessel B: box C: transistor D: submarine E: lamp<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**D**
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:A person who wants to make more at their job but can't will often need to find a what? Choices:  A: own house B: better job C: win lottery D: save money E: feel safe<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Where would you find fungus growing on something made from milk? Choices:  A: eyes B: biology laboratory C: shower stall D: old cheese E: decaying matter<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input You work in a factory that makes candy. It takes 3 people 3 minutes to produce 1 bag of candy. During the day, the three production lines run at 15%, 45%, and 40%, respectively. How much candy will you produce during a 9-hour day?<n><n>### Choices:A: 7 ½ bags B: 7 bags C: 8 ½ bags D: 85% bag<n><n>### Response:(B)<n><n>### Input There are two kinds of trees in a forest. One kind is a type of conifer tree, and the other kind is a type of deciduous tree. Each kind consists of 2 other kinds of trees. Conifer trees require less light than the other kind and each other kind of conifer tree needs less sunlight than the other and each of those. What percentage of the trees need the most light?<n><n>### Output: 20%<n><n>### Input The first line of input contains an integer T (t<= 200), number of test cases. Then T cases follow. Each test case consists of two lines. The first line contains the name of the month (either "summer" or "winter"). The second line contains an integer A (1<= A <=200) denoting the size of the team.<n><n>### Output In each case, the answer is a single integer, number of bugs in the team.<n><n>In the team there should be at least one more player than the number of bugs and the sum of the players must be not less than the sum of the bugs.<n><n>### Sample Input<n>```<n>2<n>summer 40 4<n>winter 83 5<n>```<n><n>### Sample Output<n>```<n>3<n>3<n>6<n>2<n>```<n><n>## Program<n>```python<n><n>def main():<n>  n = int(input())<n>  for i in range(n):<n>    name = input() + str(i+1)<n>    sum = int(input()) + 1<n>    print(sum, name)<n><n>main()<n>```<n>

He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. What might she drink?  Choices: A: water B: coffee C: throwing up D: getting drunk<n><n>### Response:- C<n><n>### Input:-- The 2nd choice is the correct answer.  Choices: A->B  B->D  C->E  D->A  E->C<n><n>### Response:--A -> B<n><n>### Input : The total number of animals in the shelter is 48. Three times as many cats as there are dogs. How much longer would he do he have to live if he had the operation or would he have died sooner?<n><n>### Response<n><n>If he had an operation, he would still be alive because the operation was not performed.<n><n>So he would live longer if he had the operation.<n><n>**I think the intended response would be  "He wouldn't have done, the operation" or "He would die sooner, which is not an option" since that is what the question is asking.**<n><n><n><n>## Reviewers<n>* [Ruben N](https://github.com/RubenN)<n>* [Eric-Melnyk](https://git.io/J5iG8)<n>

How many grams of candy costs $7?<n><n>Input: Answer: The smallest amount of candy is 1.79 g, So $4.30 * 2 is 9 g of candy. The final answer which candy cost $7 is 9 gram.<n><n>### Review<n>You can easily complete the task using if else statement,  in if statement, when 44 is 89 remain we need to make 44 less equal to 89, so the answer is 44 -89= -45. Similarly we can complete the remaining task by yourself.<n><n>You can do the remaining problems in the same way, in which you need to check by multiple possibilities that how much is the condition equal to the input, then accordingly we can create the if statement or else statement. <n><n>

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What might be the result of a season of successful skiing? Choices:  A: finish line B: broken bones C: broken legs D: chapped lips E: healthy body<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Choices: <n>C) Broken bones<n><n><n><n>### Input Choices: <n>Coffee is not as expensive as tea.<n><n><n><n>## Answer<n><n>This page only answers how to create the answer. You can visit the [instructional walk thru video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xv0H3D-04Kc).

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The person gave a good hands on what to show how to do the work? How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Jim enjoyed killing people, but he did it too often and the cops found out.  What might the cops do to him? Choices:  A: going to jail B: going to prison C: beat him up D: get arrested E: die<n><n>### Response:		The Cops will go to jail A<n><n>### Input;Bruce can solve a 50 question math test in less than 25 minutes, but he still takes 30 minutes. What is the minimum time needed for Bruce to solve math test?<n><n>### Response;Answer is 5 minutes because of a time out Bruce takes for 5 minutes that is included in the duration of the time taking 25min.<n><n>### Input ; In a restaurant, each table is going to be assigned 4 waiters. If there are 132 tables, 540 waiters will be required. How many tables are required at most to be assigned 4?<n><n>### Answer: 34<n><n>### Input : A football team plays 15 games. Last 9 games they win, then they lose in the next 4. It is certain to win in the 2 remaining games. In how many games will they win at most?<n><n>### Analysis<n><n>#### 9th game<n><n>Won<n><n>#### 10th game<n><n>Lost<n><n>#### 11th game<n><n>Winner<n><n>#### 12th game<n><n>Loser<n><n>### Answer : 13<n><n>### Input<n><n>Shopping at the supermarket, Alice can only carry $25 in her purse. She is purchasing milk, beans, and pears. The milk costs $1.50 per litre. The beans are $3.50 for 10 ounces. The pears are $9 for 5 pounds. She can purchase 4 litres of milk and 2 pounds of beans, and 2 pounds of pears. How much money does Alice have left?<n><n>### Solution<n><n>Money used: $25<n><n>- Milk: 4 Litres<n>- Beans: 2 Pounds<n>- Pears: 2 Pounds <n><n>Total = $49.5<n><n>Money left: $9.5<n><n>### Input <n>Jim and John are playing basketball and they are switching the shoes. For fun, they are making bets. The bet is that whoever is better at basket-ball has less points in total. Jim is always better, but he thinks that is because other players are cheating.

Choices:  A: headache B: understand themselves C: compliments D: own house E: happiness<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is option D: own house. A grumpy person is likely to have a headache so option A is false and option B is false because understanding themselves doesn't make them grumpy so C must be false, compliments to a grumpy person might be a good thing so D must be true and a grumpy person is unlikely to have happiness as they are most likely not grumpy most times so option E is false.<n><n>### Input 2:What is the maximum number of possible combinations of different colored balls you can create with 8 white and 2 red balls? Choices:  a) 8 b) 10<n><n>### Response 2: The correct answer is 10, as there are 2 red balls which creates 2 different combinations:<n><n>* Red white, and<n><n>* Red yellow.<n><n>### Practice Question 1:<n><n>### Practise Question 2:<n><n>### Challenge Question<n><n>### Challenge Respone<n>

Choices:  E: 54 minutes A: 40 minutes C: 36 minutes B: 45 minutes D: 72 minutes<n><n>Answer:  E: 40 minutes<n><n>What should you do after you boil an egg? If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What state is the John Davis  Lodge toll road found in? Choices:  A: new jersey B: eastern united states C: good repair D: connecticut E: arizona<n><n>### Response:		C

She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:If someone is aloof and self-important, what is their experience when meeting people? Choices:  A: go to church B: appear in court C: watch soap operas D: paying attention E: go into court<n><n>### Response:		 Your answer is (E).<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following short answer question.<n><n>## 1. Mary wants to visit the local museum. The museum is open from 10am until 4 pm on Tuesday, 5pm until 8pm from Wednesday - Saturday. Sunday the museum is open from 5pm until 10pm. You can pay for admission by the hour. For each child admission to the museum costs 969. For each adult, admission costs 1.06. Write a number that represents the number of hours that Mary has to spend in the museum before she pays the same amount of money for admission to the museum as an adult.<n><n>### Option 1 <n>I need to think a bit more about this.<n><n>###  Option 2<n>10 hours<n><n>### 3<n>Option 3<n><n>### 4<n>Option 3<n>6 hours<n><n>### Instructor: Answer the following math problem.<n><n>### Question :  What is the area of a square  that has a side with a length of 7 cm?<n><n>### Solution 1:Answer 1: The square has 7 cm length side. The area is 7^2= 50.<n><n>### Solution2:Answer2:1. Since the perimeter is 21 cm, that means that the triangle is isosceles, and has 2 sides equal in length. 2. Since the isosceles triangle has equal side lengths, their angle measures are also equal. So, using similarity, we can say that the ratio of the length of the side to the ratio of the adjacent is 1:1. 3. Using similarity and proportional reasoning to convert the measures, we get 3.1 inches / inch = 31 inches.  For the third side, we plug 3 inches into the isosceles angle of 36 degrees and find a perimeter of 110 inches.

How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a folding chair if you do not plan to use it and you do not have any large doors in your house? Choices:  A: roof B: school C: beach D: closet E: garage<n><n>### Response:		C <n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Though it stayed strictly indoors, the small dog felt like it had all the space in the world in the what? His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:They were getting together for the big game, he wasn't hosting but made sure to bring pretty of food with him over to where? Choices:  A: picnic B: friend's house C: table D: space shuttle E: fairgrounds<n><n>### Response:		C<n>### Explanation:He brought pretty much too the friend's house because pretty of food is at the friends house.<n>### Explanations:<n>C = prett of<n><n>A = preaty of<n><n>B = pretty with<n><n>D = pretty on<n><n>E = not correct<n><n><n> <n>![](./images/41580153_705943769970774_7394875027951279285_n.png)<n>![](./imagesR/41582743_705434180824444_7787260602240571674_n.png)

Choices:  A: books B: france C: fish market D: atlantic ocean E: cuba<n><n>### Response:		<n>***A.***<n><n>### Detailed response:<n>[books](https://www.google.com/books/edition/Merriam-Webster_s_SpanishEnglish/UmBp0JXyq2cC?hl=&page=PA1)<n>[paris](https://www.encyclopedia.com/arts/dictionaries-thesauruses-pictures-and-press-releases/paris)<n><n>### Instructions:<n>***If Sam went to Paris, he ordered fish.***<n>---<n>***If he ordered fish, he was most likely in a restaurant.***<n>---<n>**The closest to this is the French culture.**<n><n>### Input 20:<n>Frog is on lily's pond. lily's pound is part of a lake. The other hiker was Bob.  Bob wanted to go on the hike, but he wasn't sure he wanted to hike alone, just in case something happened.  Amy didn't want to hike alone, so she wanted to go with Tanya.  Tanya didn't know Bob, but she didn't really mind going on the hike with him if that's what it took to hike with Amy.  Because of that, Amy offered to go on the hi with the two of them, but all three of them are still required to split the cost equally.  How much does Amy need to pay for the hike?<n><n>## Detailed answer 22:<n>***A. $9***<n><n>### Exp

I am not aware of many churches or synagogues that would be found in a school setting. <n><n>### Instructions:Write the expression, using a variety of symbols.<n><n>| Expression:| 4(b-3c)+4a-3c|<n>| Expression:| (2016\+1989)/2|<n><n>### Response (Expression)<n><n>Answer: 4(b-10)<n><n>### Instructiuon: Write a program that prints out the expression below, with its corresponding answer. Input: 5/6 7/8 Output: <n>8/14 <n><n>### Input 4/5<n>### Response 0.8<n><n>### Instractions: Write a program that will ask for a value from the user and then 1000 loops will perform the mathematical operation requested.<n><n>### Response<n>```<n>import time<n>while(True):<n>    value = input("Please enter a value: ")<n>    if value == "done":<n>        break <n>    else:<n>        print (value," + 1")<n>    <n>    time.sleep(0.1) # Wait an extra second<n>```<n><n>### Instuctions: <n>Write a program that will print the names of all students who weigh 120 or more pounds.<n><n><n>### Response <n><n>```<n><n>#!/usr/bin/python <n><n>import math <n>import sys <n> <n>names = input("Please answer:") <n>while(True): <n>    if names[0:3] in  sys.argv[1]:<n>        names.pop(0) <n>        break <n>sys.argv[1]="All Students"<n>if names == "done":<n>   break <n>print (sys.argv[1]+" "+names)<n><n>```<n><n>## Code Walkthrough<n><n>https://github.com/z3roB/ProgrammingPython<n><n><n>```<n>#!/usr/python3<n>import math<n>import requests<n><n>#GLOBAL DEFINITIONS<n>#Define Variables<n>names=[]<n>heights=[]<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:A soccer field that is not contained in a building would be where? Choices:  A: playground B: mexico C: town D: outside E: world cup<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the question below using the given statements.<n><n>### Statement 1: Max and Sam can build a bridge that would take 8 hours but Mark can build it alone in 10 hours.<n><n>### Additional Statement:Max has a tool box that may not have everything needed to build the bridge.<n><n>### Question:Who can finish building the bridge in the fewest amount of time?

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Sky diving scared him, once they jumped out of the plane he began losing consciousness while what? Choices:  A: injury B: death C: playing uno D: coma E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		The correct options are B and E.<n><n>### Input 2:He is one of few people who have ever went down the grand canyon, once again, what? Choices: A: rated a 7 on google B: he almost died C: he was on vacation<n><n>### Response 2:The correct options are C and B.<n><n>### Question 3:<n>How many animals are there in the following list?<n><n><n>Answer: 5 + 2 = 7

If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. In the following instructions you will find detailed directions about what to do and what to consider. You will complete this project in multiple stages. The first stage will be to get a program structure working. The final stage is to create a command script where you will answer pre-written multiple-choice questions.<n><n>- When you first load the script, type:<n>	<n>		$ python scripting.py<n><n><n><n>### Demostration Script:<n>Please complete these steps:<n><n>This is the start of a game<n><n>#### 1. Inserting a variable<n><n>Change line one to include the student's name and ask the student for this information without the quote marks.<n><n>	def main():<n>		return print("Hi " + student + "! Welcome to my game!")<n><n>#### 2. Creating a variable with the command<n><n>Insert a prompt where the student will get to type in their response to a question. This will set variables for the student.<n><n>	def multiple_challenge():<n>		return input('Enter your multiple choice selection.')<n><n>#### 3. Creating a prompt<n><n>Ask the student to enter their answer in the game from the first prompt.<n><n>	student = multiple_challenge()<n><n>#### 4. Creating a prompt<n>	<n>If the variable student is equal to a multiple choice correct answer then print a sentence telling the student to type in their next answer. Otherwise, the command "pass" is inserted so that the next command is carried out.<n><n>	if student == "A" or student == "B":<n>		return print('Enter your next selected answer.')<n>	elif student == "C":<n>		return pass<n>	elif student == 'D':<n>		return pass # the above 2 lines are called conditional<n>	else:<n>		return pass <n><n>#### 5. Create a loop<n><n>Continue asking the student for choices until the student enters a specific number of correct answers. The following prompt will ask the student to enter the number of answers to be selected.<n><n>	while correct_answer < 2:<n><n>The command print is only 1 letter. This should be edited to "

If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:They checked the weather one more time during the flight, they were on their way to paradise and wanted it to what? Choices:  A: look beautiful B: be happy C: change quickly D: occur here E: surprise us<n><n>### Response:		The correct response is A or D which means that the correct answer is **All of the Above**<n><n>### Demostration:<n>**Input: They checked the weather one more  time during the flight,  they were on their way  to paradise  and wanted it to what?? Choices: A  B  C  D  E**<n><n>**Output: All of the above is correct**<n><n>### Input : What's the total number of the items on the shelf?<n><n>### Response : **767 + 761 + 439 + 438 + 187 + 353 = 2888**<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>- If two values are not zero, the sum needs to be done.<n>- If zero is in the first or the last position, the zero needs to be ignored.<n>- If zero appears anywhere in the middle, it needs to be counted as a zero.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>**Instuctions:**<n><n>**Solution:**<n><n>**Input:**<n><n>0 767 761 439 438 187 353 <n><n>**Output:**<n><n>767 + 439 = 1214 + 438 = 1652 + 761 <n><n>**Sum Up:**<n>1652 +761 + 353 768 + 18 = 2142<n><n>0 784 462 462 190 0<n><n>### **Solution 3**<n>**Instuctions**<n><n>- Two value are not zero, so the sum needs to be executed.<n>- If the value is zero in the first or last of the middle, the zero need to be ignored.<n><n>**Solution 2:**<n><n>**A.** Instruction:<n><n>**Input: 218 0 44 103 45**<n><n>**B.** Instruction: <n><n>**Input:702 115 0 0 28**<n><n>**Solutions:**<n><n>Solution 1:<n><n>**A. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:How is someone who loves their TV likely to feel about their remote? Choices:  A: attached B: nostalgic C: companionable D: likely E: close<n><n>### Response:		If you love your TV, you are most likely to feel close to your remote.<n><n>### Input : Which of the following things is not true about a chicken-or-egg problem? Choices: None of the given choices. A: It can be solved without data. B: It has a single solution set that is unique. C: It has multiple solutions. D: It does not have a solution if the given data is not valid.<n><n>### Response : It does not have a single solution set that can be unique. As they are solved with data, and it has more than one solution, it does not have a single unique solution.<n><n>### The steps listed below are instructions that describe how to do a task. Write a complete sentence in which you show that you understand the steps.<n><n>1. Open the cabinet.  <n>2. Find the jar.<n>3. Take the jar.<n><n>### Below you will find a series of task requests. Write a response that is appropriate for each request.<n><n>## Input : How do you find the least common multiple (LCM) of two numbers? Choices: You find the LCM by dividing each number by any number it is a factor of. You find the LCM using the Prime Factorization of the two numbers. You find the LCD by subtracting one number from the other 12 times to find a common multiple. You find the LCm by subtracting the numbers and then finding the largest number in the list.<n><n>## Response : You find the LCM of two numbers by finding the common factors of each number and then multiplying those common factors until they all disappear.<n><n>##  Input : The problem below contains data regarding the sales at a local car dealership from 10/03/2020 to 2/29/2020. 70% of the sales were made before February 1st. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:John joined the army because he wanted to see the world.  When the fighting started, he only saw what sort of things? Choices:  A: fort B: orphans C: battlefield D: other countries E: war<n><n>### Response:		Fort<n>

A is brother to D, B is brother to D. C is son to D, A, and B. B is brother to D, C is brother to D. A is married to C. B and D are sons of A B and D are sons A B is married to C. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Sometimes it felt like being able to pay bills was the only reason he was actively what? Choices:  A: pay debts B: make money C: having money D: making money E: keep house<n><n>### Response:		<n>>Pay Debts<n><n>### Explanation: <n>Payment is the primary reason we work. We are lucky we have the ability to pay debts.<n><n>### Input<n>>The bank would hold on to the money it had loaned you for as long as they had the money.  The interest rate is what they choose to charge you for borrowing it from them.  The government can sometimes also loan you money.  It’s your job to repay both the government and the bank.  When you stop paying, the money you borrowed becomes debt.  You cannot have debt without also having money.  You don’t pay interest unless you borrow money.  The interest rates the government and the bank choose to use are what they think you can afford to pay for borrowing money.<n><n>### Explantion<n>It’s your job to pay back money you loaned.  The person who lends to you keeps the money until they’ve collected all the money you borrowed so you are still paying them.  <n><n>### Input,<n>>After interest has been paid on money borrowed, how much is left?  Choices:  A)  Nothing  B) Some money C) All the money D) Everything<n><n>### Explantion<n>Interest is the money you borrow, therefor the interest you pay is money the person you borrowed from keeps/ gets to keep until the full amount is returned.<n><n>###Input,<n>>Maria had $10 more than she had spent, while Kevin had $10 left. They shared their money equally.  How much did each of them have in the end?  Choices: A: $30 B: $50 C: $60 D: $70<n><n>###Explantion<n>The sum of A and B is C. A and B are equal so when they are added, the result has to be exactly double the value of A and B.<n><n>###Explanation,<n>>When Kevin took $10, and Maria already had $10 and didn’t spend anything else, this left Marnia with $10$10 more than what she had spent(10 and change). Kevin took $10 from $10, so he did not spend either.<n><n>###Output,<n>>50  <n>

They are all a benefit to humans because:<n><n>- Some trees have edible fruit.<n><n>- Trees provide us with clean air and shade.<n><n>- Flowers provide beauty.<n><n>- Bushes provide shelter and protection.<n><n>- Some offer medicinal purposes.<n><n>- They can be used to make things.<n><n>- Many varieties offer the ability to make many good meals using parts of their trees.<n><n># Questions:<n><n>## 1. The system will score and grade your response based on the number of parts for which it is correct and the number of parts for it is incorrect.<n><n>You are allowed to leave answers unanswered.<n><n><n>### Submission: Save and Submit<n><n>### Review<n>Click the submit button to save and submit. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Where is a note likely to indicate a melody? The high for the temperature is 28 degrees and the low is 15 degrees. She adds the high and low temperature to get the range and takes that number and divides it by the number of days in May, which is 31. She then divides that number by two, and she has 27. She calls her grandmother and she's very happy, because she has a beautiful answer for her grandmother. Her grandmother will not be disappointed ever again when Mary calls her. Her grandmother asks for the range, the mean and the median. So Mary quickly calls her grandmother back to give her the data for those. I love you grandmother. Love, Mary. She loves her grandmother.</p><n><p>Example Question: Mary has 30 minutes to write a 200 word short story. Choices:  A: football stadium B: laboratory C: baseball stadium D: pharmacy E: soccer game<n><n>### Response:		The answer from the correct input is baseball stadium.<n><n>### Input<n>1. You can add 4 apples and 5 oranges for a total of 5 (apples with number = 4) + (apples without number = 1) + 5 (apples without number) = 10 (apples with number) (1 apple with number = 1)<n>2. You can add 6 apples and 7 oranges for a total 7 (apples with number).<n>3. You can add 8 bananas, 4 oranges, and 7 lemons for a total of 29 (bananas with number = bananas without number = 8  bananas without number = bananas with number = 8).<n>4. Add a cup of beans and half a cup of rice. The total is 1.89 (beans with number = 11.89 bananas with number = beans without number = 1 banana without number = 1.89)<n>5. Add 45 bananas and 35 apples to an empty bowl. Total equals 80 (bananas with number equal banana without number = bananas without any number = 80 ).<n>6. If you add 4 oranges, 3 oranges without number, and 3 oranges with 1 number you will have a total of 1.5 (oranges with number = 3.5). No oranges were added without a number, so add oranges with number to the whole number of apples to get the correct answer for the question.<n>7. Add 4 apples, 4 oranges (which equal 3 oranges with number), 2 oranges (which equal an orange without number) and 4 bananas. The sum total equals 8. How do you get 8.1?<n>8. You have two boxes, one with 12 apples and one with 7 bananas. You can add all of the apple boxes to the banana boxes and then add 5 apples to the banana boxes to get total of 16 (bananas and apples with number = 5 apples without numbers equal the bananas and apples without number). All bananas without number are added to the banana and apples with number equaling banana boxes without number.<n>9

Choices:  A: big house B: nursery school C: preschool D: building E: retirement home<n><n>### Response:		The retirement home<n>### Instructor's Comments:  - 50/50 chance of getting this question correct: 10/50 = 20%  - 4 correct out of 5 questions: 7/5*5 = 35%<n>#1: It's a math question.  There may be some sort of relationship based on how many legs.<n><n>#1, 2, 3, 4, 7: Math question<n>#2, 5, 8: Math question (the wording makes it sound like there's a logic question, no math involved)<n>#3, 6, 9: Math question (it's asking for the difference between the left-over and the target.  The relationship between them looks like they would be a difference, not division).<n>#4: Word problem.<n>#7: Word problem.<n><n>#404321190

He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. Choices:  A: the sun B: catch cold C: prepare to go D: feel humiliated E: hunt for food<n><n>### Response:		 The answer is choice D, hunt for food<n>### Question:<n><n>How quickly can 10 feet run in a meter?<n><n>### Response<n><n>They can run quickly in 1 meter. <n><n>### Question:How quickly can 14 feet run in a kilometer?<n>### Response<n>14 feet is 4 meters. 10 feet run will run a meter.<n><n>### Question<n><n>The person drank 50 bottles of water in one day. And then had some food and then 2 hours later drank 12 more bottles of water and then he felt thirsty again. If he drinks the next bottle how much water will he drink in total after all the bottles?<n>### Response : <n>It won’t make a difference.<n><n>### Answer:<n>Since the person drank 5, 12, 1, and then finally 25 in his stomach. Let's make math.<n>$$\begin{aligned}<n>50 \times (50/25) = ~852\\<n>852 \times (12/25) = 758 \times 2 = ~1516\\<n>1516 \times (1/25) ~= 1516\end{aligned}$$<n>So all the formulas should be equal.<n><n>### Correct<n>The answer is 5.<n>

How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What do humans do when in a race? Choices:  A: lay eggs B: eat fruit C: wrestle D: compete with each other E: draw pictures<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:What do humans do in a competition using animals?  Choices:  A) hold on to a rope  B) sit in the mud  C) pull weeds  D) chase the animals  E) run<n><n>### Response :B<n><n>### Instutions: A farmer wants to divide his 53 acres of land so that no piece has more than 9 acres and each piece of land gets at least 3 acres of land.  How many ways can it be done?  Choices: A) One B) More than one C) None D) We must have exactly the same size of each land<n><n>### Response B<n><n>### Instrections:Four friends have to divide the 40 cookies so that each person can get at least 4 cookies.  How many ways that the 40 cookies can be divided?  A) One B) Only two C) Three different D) No more than one<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Instuctions:How many 10 dollar bills, 5 dollar bills and quarters are there in 2437 dollars?  A) one two and one B) two three and none C) three two and two D) five three and two<n><n>### Response C<n><n>### Insturctions:If your friends and you share a 40 inch pizza equally, how many pieces of pizza does everyone get?  A) 1 B) 2 C) 8 D) none B) 2<n><n>### Response D<n><n>

His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.
