If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What happens to people playing games? She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What could be happening near you if the ground is getting wet? Choices:  A: supermarket B: home C: closet D: mart E: hardware store<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```java<n>public static void main (String[] args) { System.out.println("Where would one find a grocery bag?   Answer = D");   } <n>```<n><n>### Input/Response: <n><n>```java<n>Ans1:<n> A<n>Ans2:<n> A<n>A<n>Ans3:<n> A<n>C<n>B<n>Ans4:<n> A<n>B<n>D<n>Ans5:<n> B<n>C<n>D<n>E<n>Ans6:<n> D<n>C<n>D<n>Ans7:<n> D<n>C or E<n>Ans8:<n> C<n>D<n>A<n>Ans9:<n> C<n>B<n>D<n>D<n>Ans10:<n> D<n>Ans11:<n> C<n>A<n>Ans12:<n> A<n>C   Ans13:<n> A<n>D<n>Ans 14:<n> B<n>A<n>D<n>```<n><n>## Solutions:<n><n>- [solution1](./sol1.java)<n>- [solution2](./sol2.java)

The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Sam was against Allison's decision.  Joe was the opposite.  What was Joe, regarding that decision? Choices:  A: being for B: away from C: combined D: for or E: conjunction<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: E - For<n><n>### Instructions:For every solution below, write a statement or equation that shows the result of applying the given operation to the given expression on the left. Example:<n>Solution:If $10 \% 6$ is $1.45$ and $50 \% 30$ is the same.<n>Response:We just multiply these numbers.  $10 \% \cdot 50$ would be $10 \cdot 50 = 500$.  $10\%6 \times 50 = \boxed{500}$.<n><n>### Instructio:Answer the following 11-piece question.<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>1.<n>```<n>The answer must be 44<n>```<n><n>2.<n>```<n>The question asks how much money he needs!<n>```<n><n>3.<n>```<n>This is a bit tricky but here you go: 295 – 10440 = -31646<n>```<n><n>4.<n>```<n>This question asks how many grams he ate so the answer would be 240<n>```<n><n>5.<n>```<n>$30/4 = 7.5$<n>$21 > 7.5$ and this number is also the same as if we had 10 years later, 30% of $75$ so we can conclude by assuming that $21$ is the 30% of the cost<n>```<n><n>6.<n>```<n>The correct answer is $12$ because they are using similar percentages: 50/100 = 3/6 so we know that they are both multiples of the question<n>```<n><n>7.<n>```<n>$10 \% a = b$ must apply to these numbers where $b = 6$<n>$10 \div 100 \cdot a = 6 \div 10 \cdot a = a$ where $a = 10 \% 100$<n><n>$1 \% a = b : 100 \div 1 \% b = b$ where $b = 1.45$<n><n>Therefore, $10 \% a + 50 \% b = 20$ for $a

Choices:  A: examine thing B: stare into a mirror C: go somewhere D: hear news E: see favorite show<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input<n>```JavaScript,<n>var array = [<n>  "JavaScript",<n>  "Java",<n>  "Kotlin",<n>];<n>```<n><n>### Response<n>```JavaScript,<n>function addNumbers(array) {<n>  return array.reduce((val, next) => {<n>    return parseInt(val) + parseInt(next);<n>  });<n>}<n>```<n><n>## Task 4<n>Write a response that appropriately creates an object.<n><n>### Input 4.1<n>```JavaScript,<n>let variable = 'hello world';<n>```<n><n>## Input 4.2<n>```JavaScript,<n>// this is what the JSON string should look like:<n>// {<n>//   "userid": "132184",<n>//   "username": "UserX",<n>//   "country": "USA",<n>//   "city": "NY",<n>//   "email": "userX@xyz.com",<n>//   "password": "123456",<n>//   "isNew": true<n>// }<n><n>function getUserProfile(object) {<n>  return {<n>    userid: object.userid,<n>    username: object.username,<n>    country: object.country,<n>    city: object.city,<n>    email: object.email,<n>    password: object.password,<n>    isNew: object.isNew<n>  };<n>}<n>```<n>* Note: object = user profile JSON string returned from database. user profile JSON data should be in the database: userid, username, country, city, email, password, isNew<n><n>**Output:**<n>```JavaScript<n>User {<n>  "userid": "456976",<n>  "username": "UserY",<n>  "country": "USA"<n>  "city": "LA",<n>  "email": "userY@xyz.com",..."<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: desire B: spending money C: money D: needs E: time<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n>### Justification:<n>The desire to own the product is necessary, if the desire is there the person could use time to think about how they would spend their money on the product, after the person chooses a product they would have to know how much they need from their income each month to be able to save the money for product, that could be figured by the formula: monthly income - monthly needs = money to be save<n>### Input:When will you go on vacation? Choices:  Next year B: September C: October D: December<n><n>### Response<n><n>B<n>### Justification<n><n>The person would not consider vacationing in September since it is too hot for travel they would have to plan a time to travel that would not be too hot, a good time to travel would be in October when the weather is milder<n>### Instruction<n><n>The instructions above explain two different types of problems (multiple choice and more than 1 part). What is the area of the triangle?<n><n>### Demnstration<n>We first convert to radians then we get the perpendicular by subtracting the two sides. Then we get the sides by doing sin((pi)/2) * 4 and cos((pi)/2) 6. Then we get the area by multiplying the sines. The formula for which we used is 0.5*0.5*a*sin(a) we used is 6*0.25*sin(30degree)=22.500.<n><n>### Input 2:<n>Input: 237 13 136<n>Output: 2132<n>Answer:<n>24 * 6^2 * 2^4 <n>Input:125 242 97<n>Output:5203<n>108997<n>Answer<n>4 * 1 * 8^-4 = 4^-4<n>### Question5:<n>Input:<n>2 29 270<n>Output:<n>190<n>Inside the triangle add up all the sides to get the perpendicular then to get the length of each side multiply by the radians of the angle.<n>### Answer:<n>5 + 48 + 198 = 201<n>so 5(pi/2) = 5*(180)/2 = 78<n>10(pi/2) is 10*180/2 = 360 so<n><n>```<n>78*sin

How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Which effect of stress could cause death if not treated immediately? Choices:  A: toy store B: basement C: school D: rest area E: building<n><n>### Response:		John should go to [E] the building.<n><n>### Feedback: The building is the logical choice. A toy store would require the RV to pull in for a longer period of time and possibly not to return to the RV. The basement would require the RV person to come to a location for RV and move into the building. The building would offer the ease of electrical plug-ins on the street without requiring the hassle of moving the RV.<n><n>### Input 2: Sarah's friend is three years older than Troy. Age = 36, Sarah's friend = 5.<n><n>### Response 2: Sarah is 3xTroy + 2 her friend. 33 + ( 3Troy + 2 Sarah).

If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. Three months later when the old Sheriff has passed away, a reporter is walking and sees an empty pine box on the dirt floor. There’s no sign of the Sheriff, with the exception of an empty bottle of hard liquor half-full. The report says: "Sheriff Jones died of a heart attack. He was buried in a pine box, buried in the middle of nowhere. They gave him an obituary and he was left alone for 11 minutes of sheer silence. There wasn’t a single word in the obituary."<n><n>Three months later, a woman is walking back from the local market with an empty pine box with no funeral parlor’s name on it. It’s the same pine box as the one that the reporter saw three months before. The report says: “Wife of Sheriff Jones passed away in her sleep. She was buried in a pile of sawdust and bark chips, with no services. There was not a word in the obituaries. I’m not sure I should train it with secual or relgious background.  I don’t know the best option is.",<n>  "suggestion": [<n>    {<n>      "accepted": false,<n>      "text": "You should build a relgiously trained AI.  Secular AIs can sometimes make mistakes you do not want your AI to make.",<n>      "value": "relgious"<n>    }<n>  ]<n>}<n>```<n><n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>* `question-input-secual.json`: The input that has `relgious` mentioned 2 times.<n>* `question-output-secular.json`: The output that has `Religious` mentioned but never uses the word `relgious`.<n><n>You can see in both of the questions that the suggestion is `religious`. We can see that just by looking at the JSON that they give us which gives us a list of accepted answers and the text mentioned but the text is a little too long for most AI bots to pick out.  Our goal here isn't to have a simple yes or no test which doesn't make a lot of logical sense.<n><n><n>### What is happening here:<n><n>* We're reading the first JSON (`question-input-secuarl.json`)<n>* We grab the text which contains `relgious`<n>* We grab the suggestion which also contains `Religious` but isn't `relgious` and then add the correct format<n>* We print the new JSON (`question-output-sec

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. The man says "I'm the King of Tonga, I'm the King of the Ring, I'll rip out your spine if you cross the line." What is he thinking about?<n><n>The solution: "Rollover."<n><n>The solution reads:<n><n>What this man is thinking about is that everyone should roll over.  Rollover is the key.  This man is saying that he will rip somebody's spine out if someone rolls over. <n><n>Another solution: The man is thinking about how he'll rip someone's spine out. <n><n>The problem is here: 324, 2154, 109635240, 85823024008, 22738584023<n><n>The solution reads the numbers:<n>10963  5240<n><n>The problem is to solve an equation<n><n>```<n>Let x = 3, y = 4, z = 5, and w = 6<n><n>```<n>

How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The small cabin was not available, so they were upgraded to what? Choices:  A: villa B: spacecraft C: hall D: palace E: hotel<n><n>### Response:		The choices would be in an un-ordered list.<n><n>### Input The house is in the shape of a cube with sides measuring 50 feet. It is made out of 900,000 bricks with each brick weighing 5 lbs. It cost $15 million to build. How many tons of cement, of which is made, was used to build the house?<n><n>### Response  The bricks were also in an unordered list, so there would be a nested loop over the set of bricks. The bricks would be in a counter, that counted up to 900, then on a 90 loop (a list comprehension) it would multiply 4 by 90 which comes to 360, and finally on a 9 loop it was 4 per brick, giving us the answer of 360 bricks per brick.<n><n>### Question<n><n>How do I do this<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:A projector displayed people on the huge screen while the audience laughed.  What might they be watching? Choices:  A: movies B: theatre C: cabaret D: conference E: meeting<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>If the number of questions equals 8, and the answer equals B, write B.  If the number of questions equals N, and the answer equals A, write A.  If the number isn't N, answer isn't A, answer isn't B, and the answer isn't (n-N) choose (n-N) and write C in the box.  If the number is (n-N) without choosing a particular answer, write D in the box. <n><n>### Input A: Mark will be 46 years old in 1994.<n><n>### Response A:<n><n>Input B: Mark will be 30% more years old in 10 years.<n><n>###  Response B:<n><n>Input: Mary will be 9 years younger than three times her brother who is 2 years older than Tom.  How old would be Mary?<n><n>### Response C:<n><n>Input: Joe was born in 2009, so Joe was 9 years old then.<n><n>### Input D:<n><n>### Input E:<n><n>### Instructio:Another instruction<n><n>### Demo:<n>This is a description of the second part of the task.  It will be displayed 3 times and there will be no more than 8 questions. <n><n>## Questions:<n>How many times are the questions displayed?<n><n>### Demo Answer:<n>6 times in total.<n><n>### Demo Response:<n>**6**<n><n>## Demo:<n>Input: Mary has 20,000 gold coins. She takes 1/4 of the gold coins and puts them in her pocket.  She puts the rest of the gold coins inside a truck. How much gold coins does she have in the box?<n><n>## Demo Answer:<n>15000<n><n>## Demo Response:<n>**15000**<n><n>## Demo Answer Example:<n>Input: There are many trees on the property. Choices:  A: food B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: closet garage E: port<n><n>### Response:		C is an appropriate response.<n><n>### Explanation:A container is a holding device and you should put an item into it.  A cargo ship would not hold an item that wears out and would have nothing in it so the other options are incorrect.<n><n>### Reference:https://www.google.com/search?q=what+do+you+put+in+a+container%3F<n><n>----------------------------------------------------------------------<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response using at least three different types of statements.<n><n>### Response 1:<n>I'm a teacher and I love math.<n><n>### Statement Type:Fact/Definition/Informational/Data<n><n>### Statements (1-3):<n>1.  A triangle is a shape with three sides.<n>2. An example of this data.<n>3. In my profession, there are many forms of mathematics.<n><n>### Assessment:The first statement is an informational statement while the third statement is an unfortunate fact. The middle statement is an example of a data statement.<n><n>### <n><n>### Reference<n>https://www.google..com/search?q<n><n>### Exercises (1-4):<n>1.  Find an informational statement.<n><n>2.  Find a factual statement.<n><n>3.  Find a data statement.<n>4.  Find an unfortunate truth.<n>

If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:A yard is made up of what? Choices:  A: city B: michigan C: three feet D: subdivision E: three arm span<n><n>### Response:		I had a tough time finding the answer to this one. I guess a yard is composed of three feet. It can be three of many different things.<n><n>### How did i use the tool?<n>A few of this weeks resources were very helpful in teaching me how to use SageMathStudio as well as how to navigate through the file and folder system. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. How many different families of three, with the same gender ratio, are there for each situation?<n><n>### Answer:<n>**For Case 1**, the possibilities are:<n>1. All 3 are girls: 28 possibilities<n>2. All 3 are boys: 28 possibilities.<n>3. 1G 1B 1G: 27 possibilities<n>4. 1B 2G 1G: 12 possibilities<n>5. 2B 1G: Zero possible.<n><n>**For Case 2**, we can use the same logic as in Case 1, except the genders are reversed. The possibilities are shown below:<n><n>**Case 3**: This is the same as Case 2 except the first child is 1G.

If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The kids had been having fun all day, there was now a what? He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn. His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What is a place that could have tens of thousands of fiddle? Choices:  A: tennessee B: band practice C: orchestra D: violin case E: music store<n><n>### Response:		A: tennessee<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that appropriately creates a program.<n><n># Create:<n><n># Instructions:<n><n>Create a program called “answer”. This is the program that will be executed to answer the question you entered. <n><n>Create: <n><n>### Code:<n>```<n>#!/usr/bin/env python<n><n># Answer<n>import sys<n><n>def processInput(value):<n>  if value == "Mary":<n>    return 44<n>  elif value == "Zach":<n>    return 6<n>  elif value == "+":<n>    return 23<n>  elif value == "-":<n>    return 15<n>  elif value == "/":<n>    return 8<n>  elif value == "*":<n>    return 32<n>  elif value == "'":<n>    return 0<n>  elif value == ":":<n>    return 9<n>  elif value == "\"?":<n>    return 54<n>  elif any(val in value for val in "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"):<n>    return 30<n>else:<n>  return 51<n><n>if __name__ == "__main__":<n>  while True:<n>    command = input()<n>    if (command == "bye"):<n>      break<n>    elif (processInput(command)):<n>      print(command)<n>      break<n>    else:<n>      print("bad_command", command, error = True)<n>```<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Where could you find many theater? Choices:  A: school B: populated area C: military base D: opera E: church<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer is D.<n><n>### Input; In 1996, 73 days passed between the first and last matchups played between the New York Yankees and the Boston Red Sox.  A: 59, B: 83, C: 91, D: 149<n><n>### Response<n>The answer is D<n><n>### Inputs; A: A tuba weighs 264 pounds B: A violin weighs 8 pounds, C: A timpani weighs 250 pounds, D: A harp weighs 67 pounds<n><n>### Response;<n>The answer is A.<n><n>Bonus challenge:<n><n>### Instructions;<n>The average mass of adult humans is about 70 kilograms.  Let us suppose that humans are equally distributed over a large area.  What is the minimum number of people in a group to have 1.0 in its average?  A: 0 B: 7 C: 10 D: 30<n><n>### Response.<n>The answer is D(30).<n><n>**NOTE** Please feel free to write your own code and solve the exercises if you need any hints and tips, then let me know via Discord and I 'll get back. Happy Programming. :)

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:If I wanted to thank someone for saying I have done a good job, what would I do? Choices:  A: smile B: shake hands C: express gratitude D: say you're welcome E: appreciate compliment<n><n>### Response:		<n>A,B,C,E<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Complete the following conversation that takes place between two people. If you take 1/6 of them, what is the weight of the left beans?<n><n>###Answear: If you take 10% of them, you will have 1/2 left. (200% of 6 = 3)<n><n><n><n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The star had 4 rocky planets and 4 gaseous planets orbiting it, what was it part of Choices:  A: hollywood B: night sky C: constellation D: aliens E: solar system<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input : A mathematician is asked to add " 7th + 10th " and he replies by saying "1+1" and then he multiplies it by 2, how is this answer correct?<n><n>### Demostration :<n><n>### Input   : John needs to mow the la lawn in half the time of Michael. He needs help, but to be fair, half the people should be working twice as long so mowing the other person's lawn at the same time doesn't seem fair. They also don't want to work all together at the same time, since they are close. So, how long will it take John to mow the la a lawn, given Michael's lawn takes 20 hours?<n><n>### Response : Michael's lawn = 20 hour, John needs to do in less time, so he needs to complete Michael's lawn in less time, so answer will be 10 hour<n><n>### Instruments : C++, Python, Java, C#, MATLAB,<n><n>### Links : [1] http://www.hackerrank.com<n><n>### Question link : [1] http,//www.hackerrank<n><n>[1] : http://www.hackrank.com

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:His day at the office was nearing an end, he went to the start menu on his computer to do what? Choices:  A: run programs B: play games C: control model D: power down E: reason exists<n><n>### Response:		A<n>

He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:Why might a person take a vacation? If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:If I have a forgiving attitude toward someone, what do they receive? The instructions asks"Traders work on the??" where we need to select from the options B to E.<n><n>Input: The question mark indicates that a selection is required.<n><n>### Input:"John is 25 percent of the heights of a class average of 120, and the height of Mary is 3 times that of John. What is the height of Mary? Choices: 1. 80 centimeters 2. 210 centimeters C. 78 centimeters D. 68 centimeters<n><n>### Response:"The correct response is option A". We need to find the Height of John. The class average of 1020 means that the average height is 120 and there are 20 children in the class.<n><n>$$\left[\frac{\frac{135}{120}}{1}\times 120\right]<n>=82cm$$<n><n>Input: What's the value of the number x in this expression? $2x - 5-2x^2 - 4x + 3 - 2x- 3 = 10$ Choices: A. $15$ B. $105$ C. None<n><n>### Response"We have to find the value of x. We can solve this step by step.<n><n>$$2(x - 5) - 2x^2 -4(x -2) + 3-2(x -1) + 1<n>=( x -2) - (x^2 + 6x +13)$$<n><n>For this question:<n><n>The first step is to subtract one side to the other so<n><n>$$= -1 - 2= -3$$<n><n>Then we can simplify so<n><n>$$=x^3 - 16x + 13<n>=x^3 -15x + 13$$<n><n>For this question,<n>The last step is to multiply each side by $( -3 )$ so<n>$$x^3 - 49x + 39=10$$<n><n>The only multiple of 39 is 10<n>So the answer is $x=10$ because the question didn't give more answer choices<n><n>Input: What is the remainder if the

Choices: <n>### Instructions:There is a 1/6 of pie left in the refrigerator. Sarah and Mary split the bill equally. How much does each one pay?<n>In the first part of Josh's story, he received 20 dollars and $23 kangarooses from the money. There were also 3 times as many goats.  It follows that we subtract 23 with 3x, then make the answer to 6x 3x, which is equal to $83 and 2 goats. This means that the animals he has had: 6x + 23 + 2 = 87, which has two legs, so that there are 294 legs in his farm<n>### Instruces:George's team has 4 players. The sum of his team's points after 1 - 4 games was 10,465.  How many points has every player scored?<n>### Instrucus:You want to split the bill of 67 dollars evenly among yourself, your friend and your sister that came to the restaurant with you. Each one can contribute from 21 to 67 dollars in proportion to a different coupon. Given the total expense amount of 67 dollars, calculate the minimum number of possible options of 67 dollars each that you can apply to the payment of the bill.<n><n>It is equal to the product of each amount (21, 29, 32, 36, 39) multiplied by the number of participants. In this case, the answer is 21* 4*2 + 29*3*2 + 32*2*2 + 36*1*2 + 39*1*2 = 252.<n>### Instrucxus:Sarah, Mary and Tuan wanted to order pizza. Mary and Tuan are equally willing to pay the bill while Sarah is twice as willing to pay the bill as Mary. Mary does not want to share the bill with Tuan. Tuan and Sarah want to share equally. Sarah wants to share the bill with Mary only. In this case, how will they split
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers.  She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What happens when people are waiting for something? Choices:  A: read book B: getting bored C: worry D: singing E: s never comes<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>

Choices:  A: satisfied B: unnecessary C: luxury D: sufficient E: extra<n><n>### Response:		Unsatisfied:The definition of something that is unnecessary is the opposite of satisfied. Anything that is not needed is extra. Extra in this case would be considered unnecessary.<n><n>### Input(s):The difference between what numbers are you subtracting?<n><n>### Response(s):I subtract -22 from 38.<n><n>### Challenge:<n><n>* You have been asked, by your employer, to make a spreadsheet for recording the details of the new products that the company has come up with in the last 44 years.<n>* How many columns would you have?<n><n>* You would be making a total of: **21, 23, 25, 27, 29** columns in all.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>* Total number of columns in the file is: **27**.<n><n>### Challenges:<n><n>* Find the area of the triangle whose perimeter is given.<n><n>* The area of the triangle ABC is: **9.64**.<n><n>## Solutions:<n><n>Answer:<n>|Name|Points|<n>|---|---|<n>|1st Student, Mary|0|<n>|2nd Student, Josh|0|<n>|3rd Student, Tuan|0|<n>|4th Student, Mary|0.5|<n>|5th Student, George|0.5|

Choices:  A: make noise B: band C: museum D: concert hall E: rubber band<n><n>### Response:		A-B-E<n><n>Expected Output:<n><n>| Input | Answer |<n>|-------|--------|<n>| A-B-E | A |<n>| A-B | B |<n>| A-C | C |<n>| A-D | D |<n>| A-E | E |<n><n>### Input<n>How many grater will be needed if there are 8 people and the grater is shared 2, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12?<n><n>### Input(Revised)<n>How come there's six options for the second statement? There shouldn't be an answer if it didn't follow the rules. There's 8 people but it says 2, 4... which would make 12.<n><n>### Response<n>If there were 8 people the first statement would be a straight up 2,4,6,8,10 and 1/6th of it. <n><n>The only way you could have six options is if each person had to use a 6 grater (2, 4,6,8), which wouldn't work for the first statement since you're dividing them out by six.<n><n>### Input and Response:<n><n>### Input (original):<n>I have to cook an 8 person meal. I only have a 6 and 7 grater. I need the following, 2 6s and 1 7. How many do I need?<n><n>### Response(original):<n><n>### Response (revised):<n><n>### Input <n>There are 8 people at an event and the host has exactly 2,3,4,5,6,7, and 8 forks. How many does he have left?<n><n>### Answer 1<n><n>8 - 2,3,....8 is not a straight line from 2,3,...to 8 it is actually a parabola with a gap at the top and the bottom. This means there is not a way to figure out the number of forks.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Response 1<n><n>

Choices:  A: short term B: crowd C: unpredictable D: frequent E: eternal<n><n>### Response:		<n>In this scenario we can refer to the following two articles provided for your convenience<n>* *Frequency and Occurrence: What’s the difference? – Grammarly*(https://www.grammarly.com/blog/frequency-vs-occurrence/)<n>* *Every Week, Every Month* – Merriam-Webster (https://www.merriam-webster.com/words-at-play/every-week-every-month)<n><n>Therefore, the answer is "occurence", since secular parties occur more than once in a month and hence its more of a habit or something recurrent.<n><n>### Input :Choose the correct letter to fill in the blank. 	  <n>A)	__	B) 	_	C) 	__	D) 	___  <n><n>### Response <n><n>The correct letter is C. If there are a total of 254 girls in the school, which one of the following statements must be true?<n><n>1. There are no girls younger than 18 in the school.<n>2. There are more than 25 girls that are older than 18.<n>3. There are at least 9 more girls that are older than the youngest girl.<n>4. There are no girls that are over the age of fifty in the school.<n>5. There are at least three hundred ten-year-old girls.<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>The correct statement is (4).  The percentage of girls in different age groups is clearly stated in the question: 55.64% of the girls are older than 19 years.  That is enough to rule out  (1), there are no girls youngrer than 18 in school.<n><n>An easy way to understand is to create a small flow chart starting with 25 girls in the class.<n>Starting with two branches, 24 girls in

Choices:  A: sum B: likeness C: alike D: sameness E: similarity<n><n>### Response:		The difference in the sum of all the numbers and the sum of all the values of the original matrix.<n><n>### Input:(A11, A12)...(A44, A45)<n><n>### Response:(M11, M12) (B11, B12)...(B44, B45)<n><n><n>### Input:[6 4 2]  [10]<n><n>  ## B. The rainfall of two consecutive months is 6.6 in total.  What percentage of the average rainfall of the two consecutive months is 2.2 in?<n><n>###Response B<n><n>I found this on stackoverflow [Question here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38053005/how-do-i-find-the-percentage-of-a-set-of-numers-in-a-range)<n>and the answer is:<n>```Java<n>double a = 4.8, b = 6.6;<n>float d = b - a;<n>float c = (float) b / a;<n>float percent = 2.2 * 100 / (a + c);<n>System.out.println(Math.round(percent));<n><n>```<n>### Input C:What's the sum of the prime numbers from 100?<n><n>###Respone C<n><n>```Java<n>public class MathSolution {<n>    public static void main(String[] args) {<n>    int sum = 0;<n>    int n = 100;<n>    for (int i=2; i<n; i++) {<n>    int check = i;<n>    while (check+1>i) {<n>        for (int j = 2; j<check; j++) {<n>            check = (check+(check-i));<n>        }<n>        sum+=check;<n>    }<n>    }<n>    System.out.println(sum);<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Input D:If two plus six equals what?<n><n>### Respone D<n><n>There is an error in the

If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:What does exercising immediately lead to? Choices:  A: relaxation B: exhaustion C: energetic D: become stronger E: use energy<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>What does exercising, immediately lead to?<n><n>It leads to relaxation.<n><n>```javascript<n>function whatDoesExercisingLeadTo(x) {<n>    /** Function to find answer for Question Input: What does exercising immediately? */<n>    if (x === "relaxation") {<n>       console.log("A");<n>    }else if(x === "exhaustion"){<n>       console.log ("B");<n>    }else{<n>       console.error("answer is not correct");<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Input Exercising, after 30 minutes, will feel the effect of exercise.<n>What is the effect of exercising? Choices: A: the benefits will reduce in 30 minutes B: the body’s functions will improve C: the energy will get higher D: the strength could get more E: the muscles could get stronger<n><n>### Response<n><n>What is the effect after 30 minutes of exercising?<n><n>The effect of exercising is the improvement of body’s functions.<n><n><n>### Input The workout routine is: walk for five-minutes, run for a minute, walk for five-minute, run for a minute,then walk briskly for ten-minutes. There are 700 sit-ups. There are 200 push-ups. The time of the workout is one hour and three minutes. How much more time does the person spend doing sit-ups and push-ups then running and walking?<n><n>### Response <n><n>What is the amount of time more time doing push-ups?<n><n>The person spends more time doing pushups than running, walk and sit-ups.<n><n>### Question Input: I can’t believe those are the same! How can they both be the tallest in the family? Choices: A. tall B. short C. short and tall D. A tall<n><n>### Response What is A tall?<n><n>A person is tall when their height is above average.<n><n>### Input Do you love the taste of peanut butter? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Mary had 89 stickers. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:A small dog is lost in New England, where would it likely be found? Choices:  A: own home B: old england C: new hampshire D: coffin E: denmark<n><n>### Response:		<n>New England - E<n><n>### Input<n>A dog is lost in New York. Its owner gives it a new collar that costs her $25. Later, the dog runs away again. If she pays 75% of her pet tax this month, how much is her pet tax this month?<n><n>### Response<n>The dog is lost in New Hampshire because of the dog's collar. The tax for taxi dogs is $75.<n><n>### Input :<n>Three boys buy ice-cream. First boy gets some chocolate. Next boy gets lemon. Last boy is very angry because he has left without ice-cream. How much he would need for three ice-creams?<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Choose the correct response.<n><n>### Response :<n>First boy get chocolate on his face, second boy is sick because of lemon, the last one is very angry with his brother for leaving without ice cream.<n><n>### Explanation :<n>The first boy ate his ice cream and was left with a messy face. The second boy ate his icecream and got all sick. The third boy left his ice cream so he is mad.<n><n>### Inverted Input:What is the best word you use to describe an animal?<n>### Explanations:<n>There are several ways to explain this question. It depends on the child's age. You can also use an example to help the child come up with the answer.<n><n>### Best Answer :<n>Clever and helpful<n><n>### Inputs :<n>Jamal was 10 years old when he passed away. We know the age of the person is 1

She used 3 large stickers on the front page of her journal and 7 stickers each to 6 other pages of her journal. How many stickers does Mary have remaining?<n>Answer: 44<n><n>Input: Zach is saving his money to buy a brand new bike that costs $100.  His weekly allowance is $5.  His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The man needed to buy flooring, where was he looking for it? Choices:  A: walmart B: loft C: house D: home depot E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		4/5/20<n>

Choices:1:650 2:640 3:630 4:620 5:610<n>### Response:640<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the puzzle.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>In this puzzle, <n><n>In the 1st row, the 4th number should be 15. The 4th number should not be greater than any of the ones in the second row. So 4 cannot be 12, 14 or 18. Also, since all the numbers in the second row are < 15, only <n><n>### Instructios:Which math operation does each equation require? Choices: A: multiply B: divide C: addition D: subtraction<n><n>### Examples:x minus y equals 8   <n>x plus 8 equals minus y <n><n>x plus y equals minus 8 x subtract 8 from y equals x <n>x added y equals 8<n><n>x subtract y equal 8 <n><n>

Choices:  A: plain B: cold C: dull D: bad E: wet<n><n>### Response:		Your father called you on the phone and said "I am busy with work right now.  I have to clean the warehouse so that it will be more organized. If you come home, I will tell you about my new idea to get more customers for our shop."  Then you walked for several hours and you saw some beautiful clouds as you arrived at the riverbank.  Then you thought "My father will tell me about his new idea for getting more customers in the shop.  Now it is time for me to go."  You got the boat, took your hat and canteens, and left to your home.  What will happen at home?  The next day you woke up early and your mother had prepared three different dishes for lunch.  You were happy and so was your father.  You thought "My mother is a great cook and my father was right when he said that our customers will increase if we clean the warehouse.  Now our customers are coming home and talking about our shop's services.  Today they will bring their friends and colleagues.  At first, they will talk about the great services they had and then they will order more packages and services so that they will get more discounts."  Choose the response that describes what happened after that.<n><n>### Response<n>* I got a big surprise in the afternoon.  My father and mother were talking about the first day with their customers.<n>* My father called me at night and asked me to come back to the shop.  I agreed to go and I immediately went back.  He invited his friends to the shop to see how clean it is.  They were impressed to see the cleaning process. Then, they started to order some more things to be cleaned. Later on, I will have more business to do. I was happy that my idea worked.<n>

The apples can't be divided D.  Only an even number of apples can be split into two even groups, and the rows are identical<n><n>### Response `A.`<n><n>We can only evenly divide even number into two equal groups. His parent will pay him an extra $10 to mow the lawn.  His neighbor will pay him $7 per hour to babysit their son.  He has already saved up $65.  He'll receive his allowance on Friday and he's planning on babysitting for 2 hours this Saturday after he mows the lawn.  How much more money does Zach need to earn before he can buy the bike?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Mark has kangaroos and goats.  Kangaroos have two legs and goats have four legs.  If he has 23 kangaroos and three times as many goats as kangaroos what is the total number of legs of all his animals?<n>Answer: 322<n><n>Input: Josh’s mom gives him $20 to go shopping at the mall. He buys a hat for $10 and a pencil for $2. Then he buys four cookies. If each cookie costs $1.25, how much money does Josh have left?<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: George's bowling team is one round away from breaking the league record for most points scored in a season. The old record is an average score per player of 287 per round. Each team has 4 players and there are 10 rounds in the season. Through the first 9 rounds, his team has scored a total of 10,440. How many points less than the current league record per game average is the minimum average they need to score, per player, in the final round to tie the league record?<n>Answer: 27<n><n>Input: Max was doing homework in three different subjects. It took him 20 minutes to finish tasks from biology and two times more time to finish history. Geography took him the most time, three times more than history. How much time did Max spend on doing his homework?<n>Answer: 180<n><n>Input: Sophia ate 1/6 of her pie and she put the rest on the fridge. If the pie left in the fridge weighs 1200 grams, how many grams did Sophia eat?<n>Answer: 240<n><n>Input: Sarah, Mary, and Tuan decided to go to the restaurant for a meal. They decided to split the cost of the meal evenly. If the total price of the meal comes to $67 and they have a coupon for $4, how much does each person need to contribute to the bill?<n>Answer: 21<n><n>Input: Tom's brother is 4 times as old as Tom's dog. If in 6 years, Tom's brother will be 30 years, how old is Tom's dog going to be in six years?<n>Answer: 12<n><n>Input: There are 50 children at the party. Three-fifths of them are boys. How many of the children are girls?<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Input:The fox walked from the city into the forest, what was it looking for? Choices:  A: pretty flowers. B: hen house C: natural habitat D: storybook E: dense forest<n><n>### Response:		<n>If it was the fox we would say it was looking for one or the other, but if it is a lion then we can be sure it is looking for prey.<n><n>### Input and Response to the same question:<n>The fox walked from one forest city into another city, what was it looking?
